com.jwetherell.augmented_reality.common

Class Calculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jwetherell.augmented_reality.common.Calculator

  • public class Calculator
extends java.lang.Object
    A static class used to calculate azimuth, pitch, and roll given a rotation matrix. This file was adapted from Mixare
    Author:
    Daniele Gobbetti , Justin Wetherell

    • Method Detail

      • getAngle

        public static final float getAngle(float center_x,
             float center_y,
             float post_x,
             float post_y)
        Get angle in degrees between two points.
        Parameters:
        center_x - Lesser point's X
        center_y - Lesser point's Y
        post_x - Greater point's X
        post_y - Greater point's Y
        Returns:
        Angle in degrees

      • getAzimuth

        public static float getAzimuth()
        Azimuth the phone's camera is pointing. From 0 to 360 with magnetic north compensation.
        Returns:
        float representing the azimuth the phone's camera is pointing

      • getPitch

        public static float getPitch()
        Pitch of the phone's camera. From -90 to 90, where negative is pointing down and zero is level.
        Returns:
        float representing the pitch of the phone's camera.

      • getRoll

        public static float getRoll()
        Roll of the phone's camera. From -90 to 90, where negative is rolled left and zero is level.
        Returns:
        float representing the roll of the phone's camera.

      • calcPitchBearing

        public static void calcPitchBearing(Matrix rotationMatrix)
        Calculate and populate the Azimuth, Pitch, and Roll.
        Parameters:
        rotationMatrix - Rotation matrix used in calculations.
